title: Landfire.jl
text:
Overview
Welcome to the documentation for Landfire.jl.
Landfire.jl is a Julia client for the LANDFIRE Product Service API. It provides tools to query, download, and process LANDFIRE geospatial data products used in wildfire and vegetation analysis.

title: Landfire.jl
text:
Quickstart

using Landfire

# Browse available products
prods = Landfire.products(layer="FBFM13")


Precompiling packages...
   1952.6 ms  ✓ QuartoNotebookWorkerJSON3Ext (serial)
  1 dependency successfully precompiled in 2 seconds





1-element Vector{Landfire.Product}:
 Product: 13 Anderson Fire Behavior Fuel Models Fuels 250FBFM13, 2.5.0 conus ak hi All

title: Getting Started
text:
Setup
The LANDFIRE API requires an email address. Set it via environment variable:
Consider adding this to ~/.julia/config/startup.jl for persistence.

title: Getting Started
text:
Basic Usage
using Landfire

# Check that API is running
Landfire.healthcheck()

# Browse available products
prods = Landfire.products()                    # All latest products
prods = Landfire.products(theme="Fuel")        # Filter by theme
prods = Landfire.products(layer="FBFM13")      # Filter by layer name

# Create a Dataset for an area of interest
data = Landfire.Dataset(prods, "-105.5 39.5 -105.0 40.0")  # xmin ymin xmax ymax

# Download and extract (results are cached)
tif_file = get(data)

# List all extracted files
Landfire.files(data)

# Get attribute table for a layer
table = Landfire.attribute_table("FBFM13")

title: Examples
text:
Attribute Tables

# Download and parse the FBFM13 attribute table
table = Landfire.attribute_table("FBFM13")
first(table, 5)

5-element Vector{@NamedTuple{VALUE::SubString{String}, FBFM13::SubString{String}, R::SubString{String}, G::SubString{String}, B::SubString{String}, RED::SubString{String}, GREEN::SubString{String}, BLUE::SubString{String}}}:
 (VALUE = "-9999", FBFM13 = "Fill-NoData", R = "255", G = "255", B = "255", RED = "1", GREEN = "1", BLUE = "1")
 (VALUE = "1", FBFM13 = "FBFM1", R = "255", G = "255", B = "190", RED = "1", GREEN = "1", BLUE = "0.745098")
 (VALUE = "2", FBFM13 = "FBFM2", R = "255", G = "255", B = "0", RED = "1", GREEN = "1", BLUE = "0")
 (VALUE = "3", FBFM13 = "FBFM3", R = "230", G = "197", B = "11", RED = "0.901961", GREEN = "0.772549", BLUE = "0.043137")
 (VALUE = "4", FBFM13 = "FBFM4", R = "255", G = "211", B = "127", RED = "1", GREEN = "0.827451", BLUE = "0.498039")

title: Examples
text:
Full Product Downloads

# Get URL for a full regional product download
url = Landfire.full_product_url("FBFM13", "CONUS", 2024)

"https://landfire.gov/data-downloads/CONUS_LF2024/LF2024_FBFM13_CONUS.zip"



# Check file size before downloading
size = Landfire.filesize(url)
@info "FBFM13 CONUS download size" Base.format_bytes(size)


┌ Info: FBFM13 CONUS download size
└   Base.format_bytes(size) = "2.377 GiB"

title: Examples
text:
Create a Dataset

# Define area of interest (Boulder, CO area)
# Format: "xmin ymin xmax ymax" in WGS84
aoi = "-105.5 39.9 -105.2 40.1"

fbfm13 = Landfire.products(layer="FBFM13", conus=true)

# Create a Dataset (lazy - doesn't download yet)
data = Landfire.Dataset(fbfm13, aoi)


Landfire.Dataset
 Area of Interest: -105.5 39.9 -105.2 40.1
 - Product: 13 Anderson Fire Behavior Fuel Models Fuels 250FBFM13, 2.5.0 conus ak hi All




To actually download and extract the data:
# Download and extract (results are cached)
tif_file = get(data)

# List all extracted files
Landfire.files(data)

title: API
text:
Example
url = Landfire.full_product_url("FBFM13")
size = Landfire.filesize(url)
@info Base.format_bytes(size)

title: API
text:
Example
url = Landfire.full_product_url("FBFM13", "CONUS", 2024)
# "https://landfire.gov/data-downloads/CONUS_LF2024/LF2024_FBFM13_CONUS.zip"

# Or from a Product (extracts layer name and year from product)
prod = Landfire.products(layer="FBFM13")[1]
url = Landfire.full_product_url(prod, "CONUS")

title: API
text:
Keyword Arguments

refresh::Bool=false - Set to true to refresh the cached product list from the API

Filter products by field values. Boolean fields use exact matching, string fields use substring matching.

name::String
theme::String
layer::String
version::String
conus::Bool
ak::Bool
hi::Bool
geoAreas::String

title: API
text:
Examples
products(conus=true)              # Only CONUS products
products(theme="Fuels")           # Products with "Fuels" in theme
products(layer="FBFM13")          # Products with "FBFM13" in layer name
products(conus=true, ak=false)    # CONUS only, not Alaska
products(refresh=true)            # Refresh cache and return all latest products
